Package pieces

Class King

java.lang.Object
pieces.ChessPiece
pieces.King
All Implemented Interfaces:
DiagonalMover, ForwardMover
public class King
extends ChessPiece
implements ForwardMover, DiagonalMover
Represents a King chess piece
Author:
Ibrahim Khajanchi, Karl Sequeira

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove​(int[] c1, ChessPiece cp1, int[] c2, ChessPiece cp2, char promotionPiece, Board chessBoard)
      Description copied from class: ChessPiece
      Determines if the move the user wants to make is legal or not
      Specified by:
      isValidMove in class ChessPiece
      Parameters:
      c1 - coordinates of the source piece
      cp1 - the source piece
      c2 - coordinates of the destination
      cp2 - the piece on the dest coordinates (if any)
      promotionPiece - what piece the Pawn should be promoted to (only for Pawns)
      chessBoard - actual chess board
      Returns:
      returns true if the user inputed a legal move

    • isInCheck

      public int[] isInCheck​(int[] king_coordinates, King king, Board chessBoard)
      Determines if the king is currently in check
      Parameters:
      king_coordinates - coordinates of the king
      king - actual king piece
      chessBoard - actual chess board
      Returns:
      returns the coordinates of the piece that put the king in check, null if king is not in check

    • checkForCheckMate

      public boolean checkForCheckMate​(int[] king_coordinates, King king, Board chessBoard, int[] threat_coordinates)
      Determines if the king has been checkmated
      Parameters:
      king_coordinates - coordinates of the king
      king - actual king piece
      chessBoard - actual chess board
      threat_coordinates - coordinates of the piece that put the king in check
      Returns:
      returns true if checkmate has been detected
